page.title: 15SNIPPETS FROM THE PAST.
page.content: A miscellany of facts about{DENTON. {PLOUGH MONDAY}- The second Monday in January was a day when money was handed over. If farmers failed to hand over the appropriate amount of cash the footscraper outside their house would be ploughed away. {BABIES}- When a baby was born in the village the parents were entitled to collect a bundle of clothes from the Vicarage and a free joint of meat when they were returned. {HORSES}- In 1901 the Grand National Winner{GRUDON}was trained at Elm's Farm. On the day of the race the trainer put butter on the horse's hooves to stave off the cold. {DENTON FEAST}- The Sunday following July 20th is called DENTON FEAST. The festivals of the past have consisted of stalls, musicians and dancing bears.
